clinical_study.brief_title: Complications and Risk Factors Related With Central Venous Catheters in Cancer Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Complications and Risk Factors Related With Central Venous Catheters in Cancer Patients(CVCCP)

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators aim to determine the complications and risk factors related with peripherally inserted central catheters (PICCs) and central venous catheters (CVCs) in cancer patients.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the complications and risk factors related with peripherally inserted central catheters (PICCs) and central venous catheters (CVCs) in cancer patients.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.measure: Catheter-related venous thrombosis and catheter-related infections
primary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days after PICC and CVC line withdrawn
primary_outcome.description: Catheter-related venous thrombosis and catheter-related infections

secondary_outcome.time_frame: participants will be followed before PICC and CVC line withdrawn

study_pop.textblock: All adult cancer patients with CVC and PICC placed at BeijingHCH and with written consent for this study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- all adult cancer patients with central venous catheters (CVCs) or peripherally inserted central catheters (PICCs) placed at BeijingHCH.
Exclusion Criteria:
- without written informed consent
